ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Orissa Voluntary Health Association (OVHA) is the leading health association in the state of Orissa, coordinating, advocating and capacity building on all pertinent health issues. OVHA is founded and based on our health focused NGO members from across the state. Our activities serve to build the body of knowledge and expertise on health issues in Orissa and provide the tools and information to achieve this aim. OVHAâ€™s research and project activities provide the basis for service development and initiatives in our key thrust areas. We believe in making health a reality for people in Orissa. Our activities are tailored to all aspects of this mission. Orissa Voluntary Health Association is a secular, non-political and non-profit making federation registered under Societies Registration Act of 1860 (Act XXI) in the state of Orissa. We are the oldest and largest health association in the state and have been in operation since 1976. A federation with defined goals and objectives, OVHA is recognised as an apex organisation acting as a catalyst in the field of health and development. OVHA works with policy makers, planners, academics and health professionals in order to improve the health status of the people. We collaborate with government, regional, national and international bodies of similar types to strengthen their activities. Based in Bhubaneswar OVHA caters its services to all areas of Orissa. VISION Making health a reality for the people of Orissa MISSION Â· Promotion of community health, social justice and human rights related to the provision and distribution of health care services to the under privileged and economically weaker section of the community. Â· To act as a peopleâ€™s health movement, advocating congenial policies and plans aiming at improving the health status of the people of Orissa. FUTURE THRUST AREAS OF OVHA i Address the immediate health needs of most vulnerable groups, particularly women and children. ii. Enhance the disaster preparedness capacity of communities. iii. Malaria prevention and control. iv. Target the less-addressed problems in the state like mental health, tribal health, and rational use of drugs, substance abuse and sickle cell anemia. v. HIV/AIDS. vi. Include and work with traditional systems of medicine. vii. Strengthen the health IEC activities in State. viii Advocate with the government for formulation and implementation of adequate policies for enhancing the state health status.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: More agricultural lands were not used in the Rabi season after cultivation of paddy.To practice the farmers the IRRI KEEPING IN views had engaged the NGOs also alloted inputs to the farmers free of cost which creat interest among the farmers to see the result in practical.In this way the aim of IRRI became successful and the farmers became gainer in the practical field.Now all the farmers of that area are cultivating pulses as like a practice based.AND THEIR INCOME is more than expenditure.

Most of the landed properties of Kendrapara District were unused after Paddy harvesting. To make it useness the IRRI had taken a step and engaged our NGO with all support of inputs with free of cost to the farmers and made practice among the farmers by our NGO for better production of pulses in Mahakalapada and Marshaghai Block of Kendrapara District which was very satisfactory by the farmers. Now in practical the farmers of that area incoming mor5e than previous years.The project was success.
To build the capacity of the farmers to progress their economical condition than previous methods.
For COVID-19 all source of funds are postponded.Now the NGO is workining for COVID-19 IN PURI DISTRICT AREA WITH OWN FUNDS.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: PARIBARTANâ€™s expertise and experience. Paribartan has been emerged as a State Level NGO providing with Technical and Management Support and have 26 years of experience in intervention of issue based/ development initiatives. The organization is being recognized by its committed staffs, participatory management style, transparency, professional participatory approach and for long term clear vision and future perspective. PARIBARTAN has a pool of resourceful human capital to undertake research for the facilitation of rational planning and programme management. The team has successfully completed action research/implementation in partnering with national and international agencies. This apart the Core Team members have proficiency in conducting evaluation studies and in assessment of training needs and monitoring of training programme including hand holding support for on spot enrichment both in thematic as well as technical aspects. Paribartan expanded its ambit of operation beyond conventional work culture since 2009 and strategically engaged a pool of technical experts from diverse discipline/domain and have tie up with consulting agencies for importing technical expertise as and when required. Paribartan has successfully continuing as technical support agency in providing technical support to State and non State entities with support of Union. State, UN bodies and International donors in the context of waste management, meeting peopleâ€™s health needs, ARSH, water and sanitation and. Paribartan undertakes training, capacity building and research activities in quality development programme management, rural development and related areas besides consultation for District Health Action Planning & technical support to NRHM as resource agency. The organization has good contact and networking with alliances, institutions and can import technical manpower and support from public, private and corporate sector at the time of need

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Research and Information Centre for Orissa (RICOR), an organisation having experience of many planning exercises including functioning as TSI for preparation of district plans, offers its expertise in developing the Decentralised Planning Manual. RICOR has been engaged in similar assignments of developing material and documents for varied government institutions. It has worked with State and district administrations in developing decentralised district plans for Mayurbhanj, Subarnapur and Bhadrak districts. The agency has also prepared MGNREGS plan and been associated with Monitoring of MoRD Programmes as NLM in Nagaland, Jharkhand, West Bengal, Assam, Madhya Pradesh, Tripura and Andhra Pradesh for last couple of years. Besides, RICOR has also supported the Orissa Economic Survey for the year 2009-10 & 2010-11. The organisation has also worked in partnership with UNICEF for preparation of Decentralised Planning Manual in Odisha and also prepared Millennium Development Goals Report 2015 for Chhattishgarh State. The organisation has also the experience of preparation of District Human Development Report (DHDR) for Mayurbhanj district in 2011. Apart from this, RICOR has also conducted some research studies including Child Labour as Domestic Servants: A case study in Orissa with support from V.V. Giri National Labour Institute, Delhi; Study on Indebtedness of Marine Fish Workers in Odisha for OXFAM India in 2011; Tenancy System in Odisha for Ministry of Agriculture, GoI; Customer Service in Public Sector banks of Orissa, SLBC of Orissa; Trade Restrictiveness Index of India: Pre-and-Post Reforms Period for Ministry of Finance, GoI; and Evaluation of Employment Generating Programmes in KBK Districts of Orissa for Ministry of Rural Development, GoI. The agencyâ€™s contribution is greatly appreciated by government official in Planning and Coordination Department, GoO.

ngoList.title: Rudrakshya Foundation
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Rudrakshya Foundation, one of the premier cultural institutions of Orissa establised in the year 2000 in the capital city of Orissa. It has made major contributions in projecting and popularising Odissi dance and music, as well as imparting intensive training to upcoming artistes both in India and abroad. Presently it has 200 regular students of different batches. Here training is imparted by eminent and experience teachers from the field of Odissi dance . It has a strong repertory group comprising 30 dancers(15 males & 15 females) of national and international repute. But it seems too difficult for a voluntary organisation having limited resources to impart advanced training to the talented students. Our sole aim behind this project is to prepare a fresh batch of students imparting them technical and scientific training by organising seminars, workshops and lec-dems.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: REPORT ON ACHIEVEMENT 300 Adivasi and Dalit School Students were provided educational assistance inform of note books, joining fees for continuing their study in the schools. In 28 villages 377 students are continuing their study in the schools. 24 students are supported continuously for college studies. Out of 24 students 8 students after completing their study have got the opportunities to work under Govt. 35 Panchayat Raj representatives are trained about their role and responsibilities To increase the food and income security of the small and marginal families, land development activities were undertaken for 310 families in half acre to 1 acre of homestead land. 260 families were supported do develop agro-forestry programme and have raised their food and income security. 260 livelihood supported families have planted fruit bearing plants and apart from the consumption they are also selling the products and getting money. In 25 vllages people have taken initiatives for developing family forestry. In 19 villages people have formed Forest protection committee and forest were protected to avoid forest degradation and depletion. In 3 villages 3 water harvesting structures are constructed. In 30 villages 45 Self Help Groups have been formed strengthened and they are linked with the local Bank. The 45 Self Help Groups are doing income generation activities for Individual economic self sufficiency. 100 families have been provided support with agricultural implements for ploughing and undertaking agricultural activities. In 30 villages grain banks and seed banks are also developed. In 30 villages people are aware of causes of common diseases and the mothers were cooperating for the Immunization programme. 6 Noâ€™s of Health Camps were organized in the area and 495 patients having different diseases were treated. 100 families provided with kitchen garden seeds for developing kitchen garden. 15 Malnourished children were provided with nutritious supplements and their health became normal. In 19 villages cattle care services immunisation were undertaken along with veterinary department. In 7 villages 3 dug wells and 12 Spring Protection wells are constructed for drinking water facilities for the communities.

ngoList.title: RURAL RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT COUNCIL
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: MAJOR PROJECTS UNDERTAKEN : 1. Targeted Intervention project for FSW & MSM funded by Orissa State AIDS Control Society (OSACS), Bhubaneswar, Odisha. 2. Kavach project on AIDS prevention and Control at Jamsola Inter State Check Gate for Truckers and Sex workers supported by TCIF. SHG formation and group finance 52 groups formed of 520 members. Supported by RMK, New Delhi and OSCARD, Bhubaneswar. 2. Sericulture for older persons at Kusumi Block benefiting 60 families. Supported by Help Age India. 3. Community Irrigation in 700 Acres Supported by SWIZERLAND DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION AND AFPRO 4. High Productive Agricultural research and Farming 5. Regular â€œReproductive Child Care Healthâ€ (RCH) General Health Camps at Bagbuda and Murunia GP of Saraskana Block supported by Ministry of Health and FW, Govt. of India. As Rural Research and Development Council started the Target Intervention Project on Sexual Health among the Truckers and Female Sex Workers . In a first step the intervention was too difficult to start but slowly we could able to reach them in a different way. The major finding from the study was that most of the FSWs were from poor background and forced to sale sex to others. Under the National AIDS Control Programme, Rural Research and Development Council was rewarded to implement the Targeted Intervention programme at Mayurbhanj dist. of Orissa by the Orissa State AIDS Control Society.(OSACS),Bhubaneswar. The project was approved for the core group (FSW and MSM) having a target of 450(FSW-250 and MSM-200) to be achieved from April 10 to March 11 in a session of one year. Rural Research and Development Council started its work under the guidance of TSU and OSACS and also successfully achieved the target within the time period. Now in 2016-17 the project is running with the target of 450(FSW-350 and MSM-250). Objective of the TI Project: - ïƒ˜ To Control High â€“ risk behavior of the target population. ïƒ˜ To Identify the STD/RTI patients. ïƒ˜ To promote use of condoms among the High â€“ risk groups. ïƒ˜ To increase the awareness level of the target group. ïƒ˜ To create a pro-enabling environment. ïƒ˜ To mobilize the community for empowerment. ïƒ˜ To identify the PLWHA. ïƒ˜ To Provide Care and Support. ïƒ˜ To ensure the T.I. services to the target group. ïƒ˜ To make them accessible for existing health service institution. ïƒ˜ To take up advocacy for empowerment and rights of the TG. ïƒ˜ To integrate and seek convergence of the program with other applicable scheme. Income Generating Activities: 1.Agriculture: We cultivated cereals and vegetables. We introduced new techniques of farming, which are well accepted, and this technique brought us fruitfulness. We also organized interaction meetings with the villagers. Farmers club has been formed. Vegetable grower societies have been formed 2.Sericulture: As continuous process RRDC once again has taken up Sericulture in the village of Jhipabandh of Jashipur block. It has formed Self Help Groups among older persons and has organized training for them. Tasar Society provided seeds and bought back the products.
